conclusion: Identify the given values: Height h = 0.4 m, Angle θ = 37°, Radius of the pipe r = 0.1 m, Radius of the track R = 0.2 m, Coefficient of kinetic friction μ = 1/12, sin 37° = 0.6, cos 37° = 0.8
Calculate the initial velocity of the slider using h = 1/2 × g × t², solve for t, t = √(2h/g) = √(2 × 0.4/9.8) = 0.28 s
Calculate the final velocity of the ball using v² = 2 × g × Δy, where Δy = 0.1 m, v = √(2 × 9.8 × 0.1) = 1.4 m/s
Calculate the frictional force F = μ × N, where N = mg, N = 0.1 × 9.8 = 0.98 N, F = 0.98 × 1/12 = 0.08 N
Calculate the time taken for the ball to reach point F using t = v/a = 1.4/0.08 = 17.5 s
Calculate the horizontal distance x using x = v × t, x = 1.4 × 17.5 = 24.5 m
Determine the maximum horizontal distance x_max, x_max = 24.5 + 0.45 = 25.95 m

Determine the minimum value of h, the minimum value of h is 0.45 m
